definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
efferent nerve (transmitting out from the brain)/efferent neuron/motor nerve

sentences.english: Soon, the villa came the dull sound of dogs barking a few.
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿，别墅里传出数声沉闷的狗叫声。

sentences.english: The freest song comes not through bars and wires.
sentences.chinese: 最自由的歌儿可不会从栅栏中传出。

sentences.english: The transition that comes out of the initial state is unique.
sentences.chinese: 初始状态传出的转换是唯一性的。

sentences.english: Think of efferent coupling as the inverse of afferent coupling.
sentences.chinese: 可以把传出耦合看作传入耦合的逆转。

sentences.english: The salesman was afraid when he heard what sounded like the mountain breaking.
sentences.chinese: 推销员对山里传出震耳欲聋的响声感到十分害怕。

sentences.english: A sound of laughter issued from the adjoining room.
sentences.chinese: 从隔邻房间里传出一阵笑声。

sentences.english: She could hear gusts of laughter from within the room.
sentences.chinese: 她能听到室内传出的阵阵大笑声。

sentences.english: Campus communications market out again this year not harmonious sound.
sentences.chinese: 校园通信市场今年再度传出不和谐的声音。

sentences.english: Then a roar went up from the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 随后从人群中传出一阵吼声。

sentences.english: The news came as scientists continue to watch Katla.
sentences.chinese: 消息传出，因为科学家继续观看卡特拉。

sentences.english: Finally, news from his India visit.
sentences.chinese: 盖特纳的印度之行最终传出了新闻。

sentences.english: "I think so, " Lang answered him from the com.
sentences.chinese: “我看行，”朗回答的声音从通讯器传出。

sentences.english: Suddenly a loud trumpet call resounded through the forest.
sentences.chinese: 突然森林里传出喇叭似的一阵长鸣。

sentences.english: However, it is misleading to look at the ICOR for a single year.
sentences.chinese: 然而，仅看单年的增量资本传出率会有所误导。

sentences.english: The clatter of metal plates was heard from the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 厨房传出金属盘子的铿锵声。

sentences.english: Another wave struck the house. And a strange crashing noise began.
sentences.chinese: 又一个浪头击中房子，传出奇怪的破裂声。

definition: to burst out/to appear unexpectedly/to break (media story)
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
clamor raises the dust (idiom); a tremendous clamor/to raise a tremendous stink
it is rumored that .../it is reported that ...
